description.short_desc: Actions for REST request such as GET, PUT, POST, DELETE etc.

detailed_desc.p: This keyword library provides REST Actions that can be used by all three DDE Drivers--CycleDriver, SuiteDriver, and StepDriver. That means they can be used in any keyword driven test tables regardless of the test tables level--Cycle, Suite, or Step.
Each different action has different parameters as described in its documentation. For reference, the first fields of ALL REST Action test records are defined below:

dl.dd: The "T" = Component Action record type specifier.

The "^SessionIDVariable" = The variable storing the Session ID.
The variable "SessionIDVariable" can be specified under section [SAFSREST] or [ApplicationConstant].
This ID is assigned by user, who needs to guarantee it is unique.
If the variable SessionIDVariable is provided, the keyword RestStartServiceSession SHOULD be executed before executing each action keyword, which will be handled within a session. There is a base URL stored for the session, and it will be prepended to a relative URI to form a REST service URL. The authentication information is also stored for the session for later action execution.
Otherwise, it will be considered as a one-shot connection, and NO RestStartServiceSession needs to be called and user may need to provide authentication information. The parameter relativeURI should be provided with a full-path URL

detailed_desc.p: Example:
detailed_desc.code: T, SAFSREST, ^sessionID, RestGetXML, relativeURI, responseIDVar [, body] [, headers] [, authentication]
detailed_desc.p: REST Action parameters must be placed in the test record in the field position specified in the documentation. Some parameters are optional. However, the field associated with that parameter must be honored. If you wish to skip an optional parameter you must still provide an empty field for that parameter.
Example:
The above example shows two optional fields after relativeURI which are given no value(skipped).

description.short_desc: Stop a session for a REST service.
description.detailed_desc: Stop a session for a REST service.

short_desc.p: Stop a session identified by value of variable BayerSessionVar for a REST service.

detailed_desc.p: Stop a session identified by value of variable BayerSessionVar for a REST service.

description.short_desc: Perform the "DELETE" method on a REST service.

detailed_desc.p: Perform the "DELETE" method on a REST service.

If the parameter sessionId is provided, the keyword RestStartServiceSession SHOULD be executed before executing this keyword; and this action will be handled within a session. Otherwise, it will be considered as a one-shot connection, and NO RestStartServiceSession needs to be called and user may need to provide authentication information.

description.short_desc: The ID used to identify a session.
description.detailed_desc:
There is a base URL stored for the session, and it will be prepended to a relative URI to form a REST service URL. For the session, authentication information is also stored for later action execution.
If the ID is not provided, then this keyword will be handled as "no session" scenario; the following parameter 'relativeURI' should be provided with a full-path URL; user might need to provide some extra information such as authentication etc.

description.short_desc: The relative URI combined with a base-URL (stored in a session) to form a REST service URL.

detailed_desc.p: This is normally a relative URI as the base-URL is provided in a session. BUT it should be full path URL if the parameter sessionID is not provided or invalid.

description.short_desc: The body to send with this REST request.

detailed_desc.p: The body could be a literal text string for something simple. The body could also be a project-relative or full path to a file of larger body content in the proper format.

description.short_desc: The content type of the body included in this REST request. It is ONLY useful when the parameter body is specified; otherwise it will be ignored.
description.detailed_desc:
The content type can be one of following options:
BINARY
JSON
TEXT
XML
HTML
IMAGE
CSS
SCRIPT

description.short_desc: The name of the variable holding the ID (generated internally), which is used to get the Response Object from the internal Map.
The headers to be included in this REST request. Such as "If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 OCT 1994 19:43:31 GMT".
The authentication information to guarantee this one-shot connection successful.

short_desc.p: Execute a DELETE method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/CUSTOMER/0/"

detailed_desc.p: Execute a DELETE method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/CUSTOMER/0/" The "customer #0" will be deleted.

The base-URL is gotten according to sessionID "BayerCustomerService" (assigned when executing keyword RestStartServiceSession). If it is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/", then the full REST Service URL is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/CUSTOMER/0/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerCustomerDeleteResponseIDVariable.

short_desc.p: Execute a DELETE method on REST service URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/CUSTOMER/0/".

detailed_desc.p: Execute a DELETE method on REST service URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/CUSTOMER/0/". The "customer #0" will be deleted.

The parameter sessionID is NOT provided, this action is handled as one-shot connection. The parameter relativeURI is provided a full path URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/CUSTOMER/0/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerCustomerDeleteResponseIDVariable.

The base-URL is gotten according to sessionID "BayerCustomerService" (assigned when executing keyword RestStartServiceSession). The parameter sessionID is NOT provided, this action is handled as one-shot connection. The parameter relativeURI is provided a full path URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/CUSTOMER/". short_desc.p: Execute a POST method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/PRODUCT/28/"

detailed_desc.p: Execute a POST method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/PRODUCT/28/" It will send XML body "9.50" to sever so that the price of "product #28" will be updated.

The base-URL is gotten according to sessionID "BayerProductService" (assigned when executing keyword RestStartServiceSession). If it is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/", then the full REST Service URL is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/28/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerProductPostResponseIDVariable.

short_desc.p: Execute a POST method on REST service URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/28/".

The parameter sessionID is NOT provided, this action is handled as one-shot connection. The parameter relativeURI is provided a full path URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/28/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerProductPostResponseIDVariable.

short_desc.p: Execute a PUT method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/"

detailed_desc.p: Execute a PUT method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/" It will send XML body "CarSeat125.00" to sever so that "product #61" will be created.

The base-URL is gotten according to sessionID "BayerProductService" (assigned when executing keyword RestStartServiceSession). If it is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/", then the full REST Service URL is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerProductPutResponseIDVariable.

short_desc.p: Execute a PUT method on REST service URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/".

The parameter sessionID is NOT provided, this action is handled as one-shot connection. The parameter relativeURI is provided a full path URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerProductPutResponseIDVariable.

description.short_desc: Perform an HTTP method on a REST service.

detailed_desc.p: Perform an HTTP method on a REST service.

If the test field SessionIDVar is provided, the keyword RestStartServiceSession SHOULD be executed before executing this keyword; and this action will be handled within a session. Otherwise, it will be considered as a one-shot connection, and NO RestStartServiceSession needs to be called and user may need to provide authentication information.

description.short_desc: The HTTP method to execute.

detailed_desc.p: It can be one of "GET" "DELETE" "POST" "PUT" "PATCH" "HEAD".

description.short_desc: The relative URI combined with a base-URL (stored in a session) to form a REST service URL.

detailed_desc.p: This is normally a relative URI as the base-URL is provided in a session. BUT it should be full path URL if the parameter sessionID is not provided or invalid.

description.short_desc: The name of the variable holding the ID (generated internally), which is used to get the Response Object from the internal Map.
The body to send with this REST request.

detailed_desc.p: The body could be a literal text string for something simple. The body could also be a project-relative or full path to a file of larger body content in the proper format.

description.short_desc: The headers to be included in this REST request. Such as "If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 OCT 1994 19:43:31 GMT".
The authentication information to guarantee this one-shot connection successful.

short_desc.p: Execute a PUT method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/"

The base-URL is gotten according to sessionID "BayerProductService" (assigned when executing keyword RestStartServiceSession). short_desc.p: Execute a PUT method on REST service URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/".

detailed_desc.p: Execute a PUT method on REST service URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/". It will send XML body "CarSeat125.00" to sever so that "product #61" will be created.

The field BayerServiceNonExist is NOT existing, this action is handled as one-shot connection. The parameter relativeURI is provided a full path URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/PRODUCT/61/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerProductPutResponseIDVariable.

description.short_desc: Start a session for a REST service.

detailed_desc.p: Start a session for a REST service.

description.short_desc: The base URL to be stored with a session.
description.detailed_desc: This base URL will be prepended to a relative URI to form a REST service URL.

description.short_desc: The authentication information to be used during this session.

detailed_desc.p: Normally, the authentication information will be loaded from "JVM -D parameters", "Map", or global external file. Those settings are considered to be global. This parameter can be used to alternate the authentication information, it will override the global settings. If it is provided as NOAUTHENTICATION, then no authentication is needed during the session even the global settings are set.

short_desc.p: Start a session for a REST service based on URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/".

detailed_desc.p: Start a session for a REST service based on URL "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/".
This session will be assigned with ID as value of variable BayerSessionVar.

description.short_desc: Perform the "GET" method on a REST service without session.

description.short_desc: The full REST service URL.
The body to send with this REST request.

detailed_desc.p: The body could be a literal text string for something simple. The body could also be a project-relative or full path to a file of larger body content in the proper format.

The authentication information to guarantee this one-shot connection successful.
